results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where diagonals are successive self-convolutions of A108447.
comment: A108447 equals the central terms of pendular triangle A118340 and the diagonals of this triangle form the semi-diagonals of the triangle A118340. Row sums equal A054727, the number of forests of rooted trees with n nodes on a circle without crossing edges.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: Since g.f. G=G(x) of A108447 satisfies: G = 1 - x*G + x*G^2 + x*G^3 then T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) - T(n-1,k-1) + T(n,k-1) + T(n+1,k-1). Also, a recurrence involving antidiagonals is: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + Sum_{j=1..k} [2*T(n-1+j,k-j) - T(n-2+j,k-j)] for n>k>=0.
Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k) = [n=0] + A054727(n) = [n=0] + Sum_{j=1..n} binomial(n, j-1)*binomial(3*n-2*j-1, n-j)/(2*n-j). - _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021 *)
program: else: return T(n-1, k) -T(n-1, k-1) +T(n, k-1) +T(n+1, k-1)
